sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. Thanks for waking up with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I'm Anka Ula, and these are your headlines this Wednesday, June 15th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A last-minute ruling by the European Court of Human Rights blocks UK plans to deport asylum seekers to Rwanda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But the government says it won't be deterred.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia promises safe passage to hundreds of civilians trapped by intense fighting in the Ukrainian city of Severodonetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And NATO Chief Jens Stoltenberg says the alliance needs a higher state of readiness following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UK has been forced to cancel a flight that was scheduled to deport asylum seekers

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: to Rwanda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It followed last-minute intervention by the European Court of Human Rights, which said the actions carry a real risk of irreversible harm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Protesters have denounced the UK's plan, arguing it is illegal and inhumane to send people thousands of miles to a country they don't want to live in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And the U.N. has described the policy as an attack on the rights of refugees that most countries have recognized since the end of World War II, including the U.K.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Home Secretary Priti Patel, who signed the agreement with Rwanda last month, defended the plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And she said the government will not be deterred from doing the right thing and delivering our plans to control our nation's borders, despite the first flight to Rwanda being stopped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Dismissing the outcry, Prime Minister Boris Johnson has defended Britain's policy, arguing that it is a legitimate way to protect lives and stop smugglers transporting migrants across the English Channel in small boats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia says it's offering a humanitarian corridor for trapped civilians seeking to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: flee intense fighting in the devastated East Ukraine city of Severodonetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Like before in Mariupol, civilians are taking shelter in a plant complex. About 500 people, 40 of them children, need safe passage out. Ukraine's troops had earlier attempted to lead civilians to safety, but the destruction of the last three bridges out of the city had made it impossible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has made a rallying cry to his people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We have losses, unfortunately, and they are painful, but we need to hang in there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is our state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hanging there in Donbass is crucial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The more they lose there, the less strength they will have to continue the aggression.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Donbass is the key to deciding who will dominate in the coming weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After months of shelling in Severodonetsk and in the region nearby, some residents who've decided to stay are struggling with no water, electricity or phone signal, desperately hoping for the war to end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Obviously distressed, Yevgenia and Maxim ask why they're being bombed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There are no soldiers here, they said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There's no one here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Surrounded by destruction, there is a growing call for peace talks to end a war few understand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: NATO needs a higher state of readiness to strengthen its weapons capabilities along its eastern border in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg was speaking in the Netherlands following informal talks with the Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte and the leaders of Denmark, Poland, Latvia, Romania, Portugal and Belgium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It comes ahead of a wider summit at the end of the month in Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Tonight we discussed the need for more robust and combat-ready forward presence, even higher readiness and more pre-positioned equipment and supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: høyere reddighet og mer pre-posisjonert utbytte og forbruk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Vi har også fordelt behovet til å investere mer i vårt fordeling, og å investere mer sammen for å strenge NATOs sammenlignende fond.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Poliske prinsesminister har eksponert sin støtte for Ukraina.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Jeg spør dere om å gjøre mye mer for å fordelen av kraftføring til Ukraina. to deliver weapon artillery to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They need this to defend their country, to defend their territorial integrity and sovereignty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Where is our credibility if Ukraine fails?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Can we imagine that Ukraine fails and we revert back to business as usual?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I hope not.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, French President Emmanuel Macron has been showing his support for 500 French soldiers deployed in Romania since the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Macron is expected to visit Moldova on Wednesday, and there's also a possible trip to Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: expected to visit Moldova on Wednesday and there's also a possible trip to Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Jens Stoltenberg is back in Brussels today where he'll be hosting a two-day meeting of NATO defence ministers. Our correspondent Shona Murray has more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Well ministers for defence from NATO member states are here in Brussels for the next two days ahead of the big NATO summit in Madrid where leaders from NATO countries will meet. Very much dominating the agenda is of course the Russian invasion of Ukraine. There will be the Minister for Defence from Ukraine attending the meeting today. Also ministers for defence from Sweden, Finland and Georgia. We understand Ukraine will be requesting much more military support, much more heavy weaponry such as long-range howitzers, armoured tanks, rocket launchers, drones and so on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Also dominating to a certain point would be Turkey's blocking of Sweden's accession into NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For what Turkey says is Sweden's support of some Kurdish groups and also a decision by the Swedish government before to end export licences for weapons to Turkey, something that the Swedish government said it is resolving.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The hope is the issue can be reconciled by the next few weeks so that at the big summit at the end of June in Madrid, Sweden and Finland can finally become fully-fledged NATO members.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Shona Murray, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Could this image signal a new era for France?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: MPs from Le Francais Assume's political party arrive at the National Assembly after they were elected in the first round of legislative elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The left-wing NUPEZ coalition came out neck and neck on Sunday after they were elected in the first round of legislative elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The left-wing Nupes coalition came out neck and neck on Sunday with Emmanuel Macron's presidential group, while Marine Le Pen's national rally and the right-wing Republica trailed behind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Both they and Macron's party are claiming victory in the first round.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And the war of words has begun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: in the first round. And the war of words has begun. Analysts say there is very little chance that Nupes will get the majority it says it's aiming for this weekend. We'll see what happens on Sunday, but it's still unlikely. The highest projections for the Nupes and the lowest for the presidential majority give the presidential majority a lead of between 60 and 70 seats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: majority give the presidential majority a lead of between 60 and 70 seats. This is very substantial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: President Emmanuel Macron's coalition hopes to retain an absolute majority to pass its reforms, starting with the controversial pension reform. To do this, he needs to obtain 289 of the 577 seats, but nothing is certain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron certainly had an unstoppable victory in the presidential election, but there is no real desire for him to have absolute power, nor is there any desire for the new PES to be in a dominant position.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And all this, this absence of desire on the right, on the left, in the centre, can be seen in the extremely high percentage of abstention." Veteran leftist Jean-Luc Mélenchon heads up the Nupes coalition, comprising of his Le Francais Assumé's party, the Greens, communists, socialists and other small groups. On the other end of the spectrum, La Republica will be looking to hang on to as many as possible of their current 101 seats.
